data.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound 1a?
What method was used for the enantioselective adsorption and separation experiments?
data.answer: Evacuated sample of (S)-1a and racemic amine in MeOH were mixed together.

data.question: What was the highest enantioselectivity achieved for 1-(4-fluorophenyl)ethylamine?
Why is the resolution of amines more challenging compared to alcohols?
data.answer: Amines are more reactive than alcohols and tend to dissociate MOF structures.

data.question: What is the role of chiral dihydroxyl groups in MOF 1a for enantioselective separation?
data.answer: Chiral dihydroxyl groups, together with the Mn atoms and phenyl rings, create a microenvironment crucial for optical discrimination of small organic molecules.

data.question: Is MOF 1a capable of enantioselective separation of both aromatic and aliphatic amines?
Can MOF 1a be recycled and reused without loss of performance in enantioselective separation?
Does the chiral nature of the included molecule depend on the handedness of the host?
Was molecular simulation conducted to provide insights into the enantioselective adsorption?
Did the study demonstrate the use of MOF 1a as a chiral stationary phase (CSP) in HPLC for enantioseparation?
What was the method used to confirm the composition of the amine-exchanged solid samples?
data.answer: Combination of 1H NMR and elemental analysis.

data.question: What was the effect of temperature on the enantioselectivity of 1-phenylethylamine separation?
data.answer: Decreasing the temperature from 23°C to -10°C led to better enantioselectivity.

data.question: Was the MOF 1a structure stable after being used as a CSP for HPLC enantioseparation?
What was the role of methyl-protected biphenol groups in MOF 1b regarding enantioselectivity?
data.answer: MOF 1b with methyl-protected biphenol groups showed essentially no enantioselectivity.

data.question: What was the selectivity factor (a) achieved for the HPLC separation of 1-phenylethylamine?
Did the study find that the adsorption of amines correlates to the pair of available hydroxyl groups of biphenol per unit cell?
What was the method used to prepare the MOF 1a-packed column for HPLC?
Was the MOF 1a capable of achieving baseline resolution in HPLC for all tested racemic amines?
What was the impact of increasing the injection mass on the retention time of enantiomers in HPLC?
data.answer: The retention time of the enantiomer for 1-PEA became closer with increasing injection mass.

data.question: Did the study demonstrate the use of MOF 1a for the large-scale resolution of racemic 1-phenylethylamine?
